So, the 2nd point is about Muslims.
First of all we must know, who is called a "Muslim"?
Muslims are those who follow and accept Islam. Ok, so muslims are new group of people following new religion Islam..?

Nope, if you have read carefully, "Islam" means "Submission to the will of God". So, those who submits completely to the will of one and only God, are called Muslims! So it's the the other way around. Those who accepted Islam ( submission to the will of God) are called Muslims (one who submitted).

Earlier we saw that all of the Prophets: Adam, David, Solomon, Jacob, Joseph, Abraham, Moses, Jesus and the last Muhammad peace and blessings be upon them all, submitted themselves completely to the will of one and only God,(practised Islam) so by definition they were Muslims! (submitted ones)
In Islam indeed we believe that all of the Prophets were Muslims and we make no distinction between them.

Let's see in short the definition of "Salat": The Prayer is not only the rise of hands and calling out for God. In Fact calling out for God, making a request, asking or desiring something from God is called a "Supplication" in arabic "Dua".
As "Salat" stands for a constructed form of Prayer, standing in front of Allah humbly, bowing and prostrating. Note: Dua can be made in the Prayer, in prostration.

In Salat we also recite a specific Surah (chapter) of the Quran, which is "Al-Fatiha"(The Opener) the first Surah.
It's a must to recite it, in order for Salat being valid. We read in Surah Al-Fatiha (1:1-7)

1:1 In the name of Allah, the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful.
1:2 [All] praise is [due] to Allah, Lord of the worlds -
1:3 The Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful,
1:4 Sovereign of the Day of Recompense.
1:5 It is You we worship and You we ask for help. -> (Unification, Oneness)
1:6 Guide us to the straight path -> Asking for Guidance
1:7 The path of those upon whom You have bestowed favor, not of those who have earned [Your] anger or of those who are astray.

We know that Quran was sent to the Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon him).
The Prophets* and Messengers** The well-known difference between a Prophet* and a Messenger** is that a Messenger is one to whom a law is revealed and he is commanded to convey it, whilst a Prophet is one to whom a law is revealed but he is not commanded to convey it...
Hence Shaykh al-Islam Ibn Taymiyah said: "The correct view is that the Messenger is one who is sent to a disbelieving people, and the Prophet is one who is sent to a believing people with the sharee’ah of the Messenger who came before him, to teach them and judge between them", as Allaah says (in Quran):
“Verily, We did send down the Tawraat (Torah) [to Moosa (Moses)], therein was guidance and light, by which the Prophets, who submitted themselves to Allaah’s Will, judged for the Jews...”
[al-Maa’idah 5:44]
So the Prophets of the Children of Israel judged by the Tawraat which Allaah had revealed to Moosa.
“....but he (Muhammad) is the Messenger of Allaah and the last (end) of the Prophets”
[al-Ahzaab 33:40]
were sent before him to all the Nations and called to the same Message. The Messsage was "Tawhid" (Unification, Oneness of Allah), but through the time their Scriptures and "Shariah" (The Law) were different.
